org.sercho.masp.space
Class SecureSpaceWrapper<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.sercho.masp.space.SecureSpaceWrapper<T>
Type Parameters:
T - type of entries
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<T>, EventedTupleSpace<T>, TupleSpace<T>
public final class SecureSpaceWrapper<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventedTupleSpace<T>

SecureSpaceWrapper adds access control functionality to a given EventedTupleSpace. Following access options may be set:

  • read - allows read(Object), read(Object, long) and readAll(Object) calls
  • write - allows write(Object) and update(Object, Object) calls
  • remove - allows remove(Object), remove(Object, long) and removeAll(Object) calls
  • attach - allows attach(SpaceObserver) and attach(SpaceObserver, Object) calls
Wrapped EventedTupleSpace methods will throw SecurityExceptions if the specified access has not been granted.

Please note, that this wrapper has no influence on the event mechanism of the wrapped space, so SpaceObservers may be attached without restrictions and will be updated with the events. Thus, although this wrapper may restrict the read access, all observers will receive all events (like WriteCallEvents and UpdateCallEvents), and will at least partially have the knowledge about the contents of the wrapped space.

This wrapper can be used to provide security options to any EventedTupleSpace and may be chained with other wrappers transparently.

This wrapper has no influence on the TupleSpace.getID() method.

Author:
Grzegorz Lehmann

readAllOfType

public <E extends T> java.util.Set<E> readAllOfType(java.lang.Class<E> type)
readAllOfType returns all entries of a given type from this space (including entries of subtypes). This method might be useful if reading entries specified by an interface (which obviously cannot be instantiated to a template).

Please note, that the returned set is not bound to the space, in other words, removing elements from it (also using the iterator) or adding elements into it has no impact on the space.

Specified by:
readAllOfType in interface TupleSpace<T>
Type Parameters:
E - type of entries to read
Parameters:
type - type of entries to read
Returns:
Set - all entries of type, never null
